We cannot continue to kick the can down the road. Our current financial trajectory is unsustainable.

Cutting spending is possible. Back in 2011, with a majority in the House, Republicans orchestrated a spending cap deal. The resulting budget cuts brought spending to 20.3 percent of GDP in 2014 compared to 24.4 percent. These were not trivial cuts.
Last November, Republicans campaigned on ending the one-party spending binge in Washington. Are we going to renege on that promise? Are we no better than Democrats?

Critics say my actions would cause the U.S. to default on its debt. Yet such fear-mongering allows them to deliberately ignore the root cause of our perilous financial situation: Washington's out-of-control spending.
